name: Survey Chart Page
description: Full-page or half-page layout presenting survey or poll results through bar charts, pie/donut charts, or stacked charts with response percentages. Includes question text as heading, chart visualization, and optional respondent-count footnote.

grid.columns: 1-16 (full-width), chart area 2-11 (10 columns), legend/annotation area 12-15 (4 columns)
grid.margins: $spacing-07 (32px) above/below chart block, $spacing-05 (16px) between chart and legend

components: Survey question heading: $heading-03 in $text-01, displaying the exact survey question
Chart container: CarbonChart (horizontal-bar, donut, or stacked-bar), 10 columns wide
Response labels: $body-short-01 in $text-02 on chart axis or legend
Percentage values: $heading-04 or $label-02 bold in $text-01 displayed on/near bars
Legend panel: right-aligned 4-column area with color swatches + labels in $label-01
Sample size footnote: $label-01 in $text-05, format 'n = X respondents'
Optional comparison line/marker for benchmark or prior-year data
rules: Survey question is displayed verbatim as $heading-03 — never paraphrase or abbreviate the actual question
Horizontal bar charts are preferred for single-select questions — easier to read than vertical bars for text labels
Donut charts only for questions with 2-4 response options — more segments make donut unreadable
Percentage values must be displayed directly on or adjacent to each bar/segment — never force readers to estimate from axis
Color palette follows Carbon categorical sequence: $blue-60, $teal-50, $purple-60, $magenta-50, $cyan-50
Sample size (n=) footnote is mandatory — placed bottom-left of chart in $label-01 $text-05
Maximum one survey chart per half-page — two charts per page only if vertically stacked with clear separation
Legend uses $label-01 with color swatches aligned in a single column on the right or below the chart

printBehavior.bleedHandling: no bleed — chart stays within column bounds

accessibilityNotes: Chart SVG must have role='img' with aria-label summarizing the survey result
Provide a visually hidden data table (<table class='sr-only'>) as text alternative to the chart
Color-coded segments must use pattern fills or direct labels — not color alone
Sample size footnote (n=) should be programmatically associated with chart via aria-describedby
antiPatterns: Never use 3D chart effects — flat 2D rendering only, following Carbon chart standards
Never use pie charts for more than 4 segments — switch to horizontal bar for 5+ options
Never omit the sample size footnote — survey data without n= lacks statistical context
Never paraphrase or shorten the survey question in the heading — display it exactly as asked
Never mix chart types on the same page (e.g., bar + donut side by side) — each survey result gets its own chart type
